56.title: "Bloodstar"

57.title: "Bloodstar"
57.author: by Robert E
57.appears_in: Howard ; illustrated by Richard Corben. p. 6-13 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 10 (Jan. 1981).
notes: "In the last episode, Earth was nearly destroyed by a huge, unforeseen orb, blasting from up above. It caused the waters to overflow, the earth to burn, and most of the planet's inhabitants to die in less than a fortnight. Remaining was a desolate planet, with only a few survivors.

58.heading: Bloodstar.
58.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"
58.author: by Richard Corben, John Jakes, and John Pocsik
58.appears_in: p. 5-12 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 11 (Feb. 1981).
notes: "In our last episode, while Bloodstar and his mentor, Grom, were on a hunting trip, they were attacked by wild boars. On his deathbed, Grom told the young Bloodstar of his origin and of his father, who defeated the King of the Northern Abyss."

59.title: "Bloodstar"
59.author: by Robert E
59.appears_in: Howard ; adapted by John Jakes and John Pocsik ; illustrated by Richard Corben. p. 7-16 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 12 (Mar. 1981).
notes: "Last we saw, Grom told young Bloodstar of his father. The two had met some years before during battle, when the elder Bloodstar defeated Grom while fighting but saved him from a cruel death by defending him against Helva, the daughter of the Aesir war chief. In the fight, Byrdag's regime beat Grom's jungle comrades, but talk of the old leader's possible retirement has one of the young warriors plotting ahead."

60.heading: Bloodstar.
60.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"
60.author: adapted by John Jakes and John Pocsik ; illustrated by Richard Corben
60.appears_in: p. 7-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 1 (Apr. 1981).

61.heading: Bloodstar.
61.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"
61.author: by Richard Corben, John Jakes, and John Pocsik
61.appears_in: p. 8-23 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 2 (May 1981).

62.heading: Bloodstar.
62.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"
62.author: by Richard Corben, John Jakes, and John Pocsik
62.appears_in: p. 15-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 4 (July 1981).
notes: "While on the road, desperately attempting to avenge the death of his wife, Helva, Bloodstar met up with Loknar, Helva's former suitor and his mortal enemy. After a brutal hand-to-hand combat between the two, Bloodstar slew the ex-Aesir war chief, and encountered in the process the horrible demon who haunts the valley."

157.title: Bloom County
157.author: by Berke Breathed.
157.series: Jan. 9, 1986) "Today the World's First Artificial Nose Recipient Took a Wheelchair Ride Around the Hospital Parking Lot"*

158.title: Bloom County
158.author: Breathed.
158.series: July 17, 1986) "Seize the Moral High Ground, in Other Words"*
notes: Oliver is going to use his VCR and satellite dish to wreak havoc on the communications network.

159.title: Bloom County
159.author: Breathed.
159.series: Aug. 21, 1986) "I Was Aiming for Aunt Fergie's Hips"*
notes: Summary: Prince William tries polo, and hits the Queen Mother on the head.

160.title: Bloom County
160.author: by Berke Breathed.
notes: Summary: Opus is undergoing male bonding: beer and television sports.

161.title: Bloom County
161.author: by Berke Breathed.
161.series: Dec. 1, 1986) "The Two Turnips Stuck in his Ears Making Life Bearable, But Only Barely"*
notes: Summary: Rosebud hears the band rehearsing (Opus on tuba, Hodge-Podge on percussion, and Bill twanging his tongue), and retreats to read Sinatra, by Kitty Kelly.

162.title: Bloom County
162.author: by Berke Breathed.
notes: Summary: Opus is in trouble for inserting the words 'George Bush is a twinkie' into the band's song, 'Leper Lover.'

163.title: Bloom County
163.author: by Berke Breathed.
163.series: Dec. 8, 1986) "The Hottentots are Running Amok in the Music Business"*
notes: Summary: Rosebud is a little put off by Opus's rock band costume.

164.title: Bloom County
164.author: by Berke Breathed.
164.series: Mar. 2, 1987) "Hey, there's a Gopher Wetting on my Foot"*
notes: Summary: Binkley visits his future self, and his little house called a manor, his Volkswagen called a Lamborghini, and his dog named Rambo.

165.title: Bloom County
165.author: by Berke Breathed.
165.series: Sept. 30, 1987) "And Reserve the Chevy Chase Suite at the Betty Ford Center Through 1988"*
notes: Summary: Milo telephones an order for a deluxe lifestyle package for Bill, including a Los Angeles home, a Porsche, a Harley, a dishonest manager and a fashion model wife.

166.title: Bloom County
166.author: by Berke Breathed.
166.series: Oct. 20, 1987) "Oh Just Look For The Union Label"*
notes: Summary: The walkout is on, though Cutter John has to be carried by Hodge-Podge and Portnoy, and the last panel shows only his wheelchair.

167.title: Bloom County
167.author: Breathed.
167.series: Dec. 3, 1987) "He Says His Lips Are Frozen"*
notes: Summary: Cutter John's not really stuck, his wheelchair has four-wheel drive.

168.title: Bloom County
168.author: Breathed.
168.series: Oct. 13, 1988) "There's a Gang War Going On in Our Front Yard Over Tonic Turf"*
notes: Summary: Bald men are robbing banks to afford Oliver's baldness cure.

169.title: Bloom County
169.author: Breathed.
169.series: Nov. 10, 1988) "That's Me. Just Another Political Pooper-Scooper"*
notes: Summary: After the election, Opus picks up an exhausted Milo from the sidewalk.

170.title: Bloom County
170.author: by Berke Breathed.
170.series: Nov. 21, 1988) "Our Candidate Barfed a Hairball on Connie Chung"*
notes: Summary: Opus and Milo reexamine their failed Bill 4 President campaign.

171.title: Bloom County
171.author: Breathed.
171.series: Feb. 15, 1989) "Turnips! I've Been Forced to Eat Turnips to Survive!"*
notes: Summary: Donald Trump does a scene from Gone with the Wind in Bill the Cat's body.

172.title: Bloom County
172.author: Breathed.
notes: Summary: In Bill the Cat's body, Donald Trump tries to woo Ivana back by promising not to spit hairballs on her; Opus has a suggestion.

173.title: Bloom County
173.author: Breathed.
173.series: Mar. 15, 1989) "It's Some Guy Reading Off Pentagon Weapons Contracts"*
notes: Summary: Opus gets an obscene telephone call.

174.title: Bloom County
174.author: Breathed.
notes: Summary: Over the telephone, Opus gets advice about wearing rubbers on rainy days and marrying a plain girl.

175.title: Bloom County
175.author: Breathed.
175.series: May 27, 1989) "Barring Any Copulating Bugs in the Binding, No"*
notes: Summary: The question is, is there any sex in Opus's autobiography.

176.title: Bloom County
176.author: Breathed
176.series: 1990) "You are a Bolshevik Weenie if you Don't Vote for Senator Glump"*
176.appears_in: p. 17 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: The television is telling people what to do.
